string.value: #b#p2020005##k said he will conduct an experiment with the ingredients, and told me to come back to him in a little bit.
I tried the experiment with b#p2020005##k but unfortunately it failed. #b#p2020005##k told me to go to see #b#p2030012##k, an expert on magic ingredients.
#b#p2030012##k said the inverse attributes is a bunch of nonsense. Nevertheless, he seemed intrigued by it and told me to go see #b#p2012017##k, the mad scientist in Orbis.
You gathered everything but unfortunately, the experiment didn't work out.
Not that I totally failed. I found out why inverse element-based magic doesn't work. The magic itself doesn't have any problem. There's something wrong with the #bmagic ingredients#k.
So I will change the ingredients and continue to work on it. It's troublesome and hard. But, that's what science is. You'll help me right?
I thought you would Say so. Do you know #b#p2030012##k? He's been studying for a long time at the #bOrbis tower#k and knows everything about ingredients. He can help.
You look tired of gathering ingredients. Whenever you feel like studying, come back.
Coughing...Hmm. What made you come here? Adventurers don't come this far. What can I do for you? \r\n#b#L0#I'm studying the inverse element-based magic with #p2020005#. I need your help.#l
I know #b#p2020005##k. He has a really strange theory. Inverse element-based magic? It can't be real.\r\n#b#L0#It's a magicians job to make everything possible.#l
If it was possible, many magicians would have learned it already. It's interesting theory though...
It might be possible. Why don't you ask a scientist?
Do you know #b#p2012017##k? He is concerned with magic as well as science. Ask him for help.
Don't you know where #b#p2030012##k is? He's in the corner of Orbis tower.
